basics.name: Konstantinos Ziliaskopoulos
basics.label: PhD Candidate
basics.summary: A Texas-born PhD student working on validating AI models and evaluating their robustness through simulation and optimization.

work.name: FTI Consulting
work.summary: Developed an inventory control optimization model using simulation and mixed integer linear programming for the US Air Force as part of a research assistantship.

work.name: Auburn University
work.summary: Participated in a teaching assistantship for over 200 undergrads in Deterministic Operations Research, Statistical Quality Control, Modern Tools for Data Analytics.

work.name: ATHENA Research Center
work.summary: Worked on a Horizon Europe project (4.1 million €) focused on biodiversity, BIONEXT.
highlights: Participated and published a systematic literature review of 2633 articles on resource interlinkages by collaborating with 9 other partner institutions in 7 other countries.
Developed 6 national dynamic simulation models for resource management and their impact on the 17 Sustainable Development Goals in Europe.

work.name: University of Thessaly, Greece
work.position: Research Associate – Data Science, Department of Environmental Sciences
work.summary: Worked on 4 interdisciplinary European Horizon 2020 projects with 100+ European partners on data science and machine learning applications on climate hazards and urban sustainability.
highlights: Led part of a 1,000,000€ case study in Athens, Greece, resulting in 3 journal publications on network analysis, knowledge graphs, and graph databases, and quantifying vulnerability through model inference and geospatial data analysis for ARSINOE.
Managed front-end development for a case study database for over 2000 case studies and set up a GCP database and API to serve the platform.

work.name: SingularLogic
work.summary: Secured a 1-year Marie-Curie fellowship on the ENDORSE European HORIZON project.
highlights: Developed a video encoding algorithm in Python.
Published IEEE conference paper based on the project.

awards.title: NSF Travel Award for IEOM World Congress
awards.awarder: Dr. Ahad Ali, Lawrence Technological University
awards.summary: Secured full funding for travel and accommodation to attend the IEOM World Congress in Windsor, Canada, and present a poster.

awards.title: Marie-Curie Fellowship ENDORSE
awards.summary: Through the Horizon 2020 program ENDORSE, I received a 1-year fellowship to work on video encoding algorithms and publish an IEEE conference paper as an early-stage researcher.
